pageContext.claim: “In the last 10 years, our economy has grown at an average of only around 2 percent, and some would say less than that.”
pageContext.analysis: This is misleading. By going back 10 years, Trump includes the worst recession since the Great Depression, which brings down the 10-year average. The quarterly average since the recession was well above 2 percent, even hitting 5 percent in the third quarter of 2014. The GDP growth rate for the United States averaged 3.22 percent from 1947 to 2017.
